Key Match Events: DeMar DeRozan scored the Kings’ first eight points in overtime
Keegan Murray tipped in his own missed shot with 3.9 seconds to play to give Sacramento a one-point lead
Devin Booker made a free throw to tie the game at 111
DeRozan scored on a three-point play to start the overtime period and the Kings never trailed after that
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Suns played without Kevin Durant, who was injured Friday and will miss at least two weeks
Others: Domantas Sabonis recorded his ninth consecutive double-double for the Kings with 20 points and 12 rebounds before fouling out in overtime
Murray committed a foul on the Suns’ inbounds play
Bradley Beal led Phoenix (8-2) with 28 points
Suns center Jusuf Nurkic was questionable for Sunday’s game with left ankle soreness
He started and played 15 minutes, grabbing seven rebounds before being ruled out at halftime
Mason Plumlee, who played in Nurkic’s place, finished with six points, 11 rebounds and six assists
The Kings play at San Antonio on Monday. The Suns travel to play Utah on Tuesday for the In-Season tournament
